responsibilities: Write product or system development code.
Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.
skills: Software development in one or more programming languages.
Knowledge of data structures or algorithms.
Experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence.
Experience in Generative AI (Large Language Models, Multi-Modal, Large Vision Models).
Performance, large scale systems data analysis, visualization tools, or debugging.
Code and system health, diagnosis and resolution, and software test engineering.
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on software development, code review, design reviews, documentation, and debugging. These are general software engineering tasks that do not specifically indicate work with Generative AI or language models. However, the skills section provides more insight. It mentions experience with machine learning algorithms and tools, which is a broad category that could include work with Generative AI. More specifically, it explicitly lists "Experience in Generative AI (Large Language Models, Multi-Modal, Large Vision Models)" as a required skill. This directly indicates that the job involves working with Generative AI and language models.
